title: 103_hr1201
content: Between January 1, 1977, and June 30, 1985, individuals who enlisted have the opportunity to join the All-Volunteer Force Educational Assistance Program. Between January 1, 1977, and June 30, 1985, eligible veterans who enlisted during that time frame can enroll in the All-Volunteer Force Educational Assistance Program. The Secretary of Defense will allow individuals meeting specific criteria to apply for benefits under this section. Between January 1, 1977, and June 30, 1985, eligible veterans who enlisted during that time frame can enroll in the All-Volunteer Force Educational Assistance Program. The Secretary of Defense will allow individuals meeting specific criteria to apply for benefits under this section, leading to entitlement to basic educational assistance under this chapter. Individuals who elect to receive basic educational assistance under this chapter will have their basic pay reduced by $1,200, unless the Secretary of Defense deems it administratively infeasible, in which case the individual must pay $1,200 to the Treasury. No educational assistance will be provided to individuals who have not had their pay reduced or paid the required amount to the Secretary of Defense. Individuals enrolled in the educational benefits program provided by chapter 32 can disenroll by making an election. Upon disenrollment, the Secretary will refund unused contributions to the individual and the Secretary of Defense. Contributions made by the Secretary of Defense will also be refunded. The Secretary of Defense's contributions to the Post-Vietnam Era Veterans Education Account for individuals enrolled in the educational benefits program will remain in the account for benefit payments. Conforming amendments are made to the table of sections in chapter 30 of the title. Amendments are made to various sections of the title, including allowing individuals who enlisted between 1977 and 1985 to enroll in the program.
